machine.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a piece of equipment with moving parts that uses power such as electricity to do a particular job
machine.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Could you get me a coffee from the drinks machine?
Did you put my dirty shirts in the machine  (=washing machine)?
I left a message for you on your machine  (=telephone answering machine).
The machine wouldn’t let me have any money  (=cash machine).
Is the washing machine working now?
Turn the machine off before removing the cover.
The letters are sorted by machine.
machine.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a group of people who control and organize something – often used to show disapproval
machine.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: the bureaucrats of the party machine
machine.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Riders have to learn to handle their machines in all conditions.
That’s a mean machine (=very fast and attractive vehicle) you have there.
machine.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a person or animal that does something very well or without having to think about it
machine.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: In the tiger, nature has produced the perfect hunting machine.
I’m not a golfing machine. I make mistakes just like anyone else.
machine.translation[0].definitions[5].de: someone who seems to behave like a machine and to have no feelings or thoughts
machine.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Turn the machine on and slowly add the hot liquid.
Is the tape machine switched off?
Have you been taught to operate the machine properly?
Can you use the copy machine?
The machine works using solar power.
300 new machines have been installed across the country.
How much will it cost to upgrade the machine?
Put your dirty clothes straight in the washing machine.
Can I borrow your sewing machine to make some curtains?
There’s a message on the answering machine.
She was at the coffee machine last time I saw her.
You can buy hot drinks from the vending machine in the corridor.
I need to stop at a cash machine.
He has been on a life-support machine since the accident.
machine.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: a piece of equipment with moving parts that uses power such as electricity to do a particular job
a washing machine
an X-ray machine
Staff are trained to operate the machine.
appliance
a machine or piece of electrical equipment, usually a large one, that people use in the home
The store sells kitchen appliances such as refrigerators, dishwashers, and toasters.
We carry out repairs on a range of household appliances.
device
a piece of equipment, usually a small electronic one, that does a special job
electronic listening devices
50,000 people downloaded the music to computers or portable devices such as iPods.
The device is fitted to the car and can detect stationary objects ahead.
gadget
a small, useful, and cleverly-designed tool or machine
high-tech gadgets
He buys all the latest gadgets.
contraption
a machine or piece of equipment that looks strange or complicated
There was a bizarre contraption for polishing the floor.
machine.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to fasten pieces of cloth together using a sewing machine
machine.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make or shape something using a machine
machine.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a piece of equipment that uses power such as electricity to do a particular task
machine.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Labour and machines are both at full capacity in the production department.
We plan to upgrade all machines used for data input.
machine.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to make or shape something with a special machine
machine.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Something like 60 tools may be used to machine a single item.
